英文法規名稱: Regulations Governing the Designation and Management of Hospitals for the Health Examination of Employed Aliens after Entry
中文法規名稱: 受聘僱外國人入國後健康檢查醫院指定與管理辦法
沿革內容:
1.Formulated and announced in 11 articles by the Department of Health, the Executive Yuan, on 13 July 2004, under Shu-Shou-Chi Order No. 0930000675
2.Amended Article 2, Article 3, Article 4, Article 7 and Article 9 and announced by the Department of Health, the Executive Yuan, on September 4, 2006, under Shu-Shou-Chi Order No. 0950000626
3.Amended Article 4 and announced by the Department of Health, the Executive Yuan, on 7 November 2008, under Shu-Shou-Chi order No. 0970001209
4.Amended Article 4, 8, 9 and Article 11 and announced by the Ministry of Health and Welfare on January 15, 2014 under Bu-Shou-Chi Order No.1020103833, with the exception of Article4 and Article 8 are to be implemented on March 1, 2014, the rest shall be implemented on January 15, 2014
5.Amended Article 3 and Article 4 and announced by the Ministry of Health and Welfare on July 31, 2015 under Bu-Shou-Chi Order No. 1040100291

法規內容.條文內容: This set of Regulations is formulated in accordance with regulations of Paragraph 4 of article 48 of the Employment Service Act.

Hospitals with qualifications of the following subparagraphs may apply to be designated hospitals for the health examination of employed aliens after entry (hereafter referred to as the designated hospitals).
1.Being accredited as regional and above teaching hospital or qualified as teaching hospital by the new hospital accreditation system;
2.In performing test items designated by the central competent health authority, the performance has been effectively accredited by accrediting authorities under the mutual recognition agreement of the International Laboratory Accreditation Cooperation or other international laboratory accrediting authorities.
Hospitals in offshore islands may, upon recommendation of the local competent health authority, apply to be designated hospitals. They shall not be restricted by the qualification requirements of the preceding Paragraph.

Designated hospitals, when performing health examination for employed aliens, shall meet relevant regulations of medical laws and also the following regulations:
1.Shall correctly check the identity of the examinees, and establish procedures to prevent specimens from being adulterated or changed;
2.Shall use large film or digital imaging (14in x 14in/14in x 17in) for chest x-ray examination; shall be read by radiology specialist or thoracic medicine specialist;
3.Examination for Hansen's disease shall be performed by either dermatology specialist or physicians who have been, in the last three years, to the Hansen's disease training programs recognized by the Ministry of Health and Welfare and are qualified. If suspected Hansen's disease foci are detected on examination, arrangements for further examinations of cases shall be made, or cases shall be assisted for referral to dermatology specialty clinic of dermatology specialist training hospital for examination.
4.Each testing shall be subject to, at least once every year, the external proficiency testing scheme or quality control monitoring; if no such proficiency testing scheme or quality control monitoring is available domestically, this regulation does not apply.
Designated hospitals shall safe-keep for certain period of time required by relevant laws and regulations the health examination records, medical records, X-ray films, and laboratory testing reports of employed aliens.
When competent health authorities at various levels, by needs of operation, request to read and inspect the information of the preceding Paragraph, designated hospitals shall not refuse.
Designated hospitals shall, within 25 days beginning of accepting employed Category 2 Aliens for periodical health examination, submit the list of results of their health examination to local competent health authorities.

Designated hospitals shall conduct health examination for employed aliens in the hospital, and shall not commission other institutions for such functions. Test items not designated by the central competent health authority shall be exempt from this restriction.

Competent health authorities at various levels may perform quality inspection on designated hospitals; designated hospitals shall not evade, hinder or refuse.
Implementation of the inspection of the preceding Paragraph may be commissioned to relevant organizations, academic institutions or groups.

Designated hospitals, when performing health examination for employed aliens, shall issue certificate of health examination; if any of the health examination items fail, and they meet the definitions for reporting of communicable diseases, they shall be reported as cases of communicable diseases in accordance with relevant regulations of the Communicable Disease Control Act.

Designated hospitals may, within two to four months prior to the expiration of the validity of designation, submit the following documents to the competent health authority of the locality for forwarding to the central competent health authority for application of extension:
1.Application for extension as designated hospital for the health examination of employed aliens;
2.Documents required under regulations of Subparagraphs 2 through 4 of Paragraph 1 of article 3.
Extension shall be granted when the extension application is reviewed and approved. Each extension is valid for three years.

Hospitals designated by the central competent health authority for the health examination of alien laborers before the announcement and implementation of this set of Regulations, if they are not of one of the conditions for revocation mentioned in article 8, they shall be considered designated hospitals. Their designation is valid till 15 July 2006.
Applications submitted before the announcement and implementation of this set of Regulations and are not yet designated, shall be reapplied in accordance with the regulations of this set of Regulations after the announcement and implementation of this set of Regulations.
Application for designation made in the two years after the announcement and implementation of this set of Regulations shall be exempt from the revocation of the regulations of Subparagraph 2 of Paragraph 1 of article 2. Designation will be revoked if effective certificate regulated by the subparagraph is not obtained before 15 July 2006.
With the exception of Article 4 and Article 8 that were amended and announced on January 15, 2014 that will be implemented on March 1, 2014, the rest will become effective on the day of announcement.
